result.execSummary:
The defendant Leon Ardell Hutton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $265.60 fine/cost to be paid to COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.
Must pay the $250.00 DNA surcharge to the COCC within 60 days or set up payment plan.  Failure to pay will be warrant.
May not possess or use firearms or body armor.  Must turn guns over the father.
May not vote or hold public office.  No abusive contact with Jennifer Hutton.

timeConds.notes: Must complete 25 hours in each year of Probation.

supervisions.notes:
Subject to Good Time.
Subject to Work Release.
Concurrent with: Conditional Jail Time in 14CF262.

May not vote until civil rights are restored.
May not hold elected office.
Other civil rights may be lost.
If not US citizen may face deportation or loss of other civil rights.
May not possess/use firearms or body armor.

CASES: 14CF20 & 14CF262.Defendant Leon Ardell Hutton in court with attorney Joel Kenneth Larimore.  Defendant Leon Ardell Hutton in custody.  Stephen C. Dorrance appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CW-clerk 10:57 am.  Exh 1-victim statement.  Exh 2-Inmate Log.
14CF262-CT-Repeater is stricken as to count 1.  Count 1-NC plea.  CT-accept plea, adj guilty.  Count 2-DRI for sentencing.  CT grants waiver of PSI.  
CT finds not elig for CIP or SA pgm.

14CF20-Order 9 mo PCJ, subj to GT & WR, credit for 151 days.  Court costs already taken.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost.  If not US citizen face deportation or loss of other civil rights, no body armor.  

14CF262-I&S 6 yr, 3 IC & 3 yr ES.  Not elig for CIP or SA pgm.  Probation up to 3 yrs.  Order 90 days conditional time, runs w/ other sentence - not subj to GT but subj to WR.  Credit for 151 days if revoked.  Follow COMPAS & follow requirements of DHS re CHIPS cases.  DNA sample, no surcharge.  CT costs are waived.  Contact w/ Ms Hutton is to be determined by probation.  No firearms, cannot vote until civil rights restored, cannot hold elected office, other civil rights may be lost.  If not US citizen face deportation or loss of other civil rights, no body armor.  PCR.  12:05 pm adj.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 17, 2014 at 11:00 am.
